page.title: 17Buildings in Shelton
page.content: Of the 21 houses in Shelton, 3 are Grade 2 Listed Buildings. Shelton Hall is now a farmhouse but was once part of a moated rectangular building on a Medieaval site. The Old Rectoryis a fine Georgian building and the Old Rectory Cottage is 17th Century. There is also a pair of semi-detachrd Council houses. Shelton has several times won the Best Kept Village award. This is an annual competition run by the Bedfordshire Rural Community Council and is judged by a group of people with varying interests. The winner holds the trophy for the year and the name of the village is engraved upon the cup.
